sub_title: Transforming Container Shipping | Program and Product Lead | Digital Transformation | Maritime Professional
summary:
Kshitij (KP) enjoys challenges and solving problems - a passion that starts with a curiosity to understand how, what and why of the challenge and address it by making incremental and visible improvements in process, people and technology. He loves collaboration and co creation. As a leader he believes in the power of "unity in diversity"

At Digital Container Shipping Association, he focuses on establishing standards for a common technology foundation that enables global collaboration across the Container Shipping industry. 

Prior to DCSA, he has worked six years in Management Consulting and Engineering & Construction (EPC) industry delivering capital projects for global chemical, energy and advanced manufacturing clients. During this time he has helped clients and management teams in various industries to improve procurement performance of their organization. He has experience working across Asia and Europe. He managed teams running estimate preparation, bids, negotiations, cost and project controls, procurement and logistics for a portfolio of oil majors and industrial suppliers, while also acting as an Innovation Catalyst, a global role within Fluor Corporation. 

Kshitij (KP) holds an Master's degree from the prestigious TU Delft, Netherlands. He also holds a B.S. in Marine Engineering from BITS Pilani (India) with distinction and All round achievement award.

In his spare time, KP is an avid quizzer and loves to play football and cricket. He also follows his passion for cooking and keeps up to date with world affairs

projects.title: Supply Chain Analysis and Engineering of ship building in Rotterdam.
projects.description: In this report we analysed the current situation of shipbuilder in regard to its supply chain management. To do this we first layed out the company overview and information about the current situation of its logistics. In the second part we made use of a framework consisting of multiple analyses to make a sound judgment of the current supply chain management. In the final part  conclusions were drawn from the framework and made recommendations on feasible actions shipbuilder could take to improve its position.

projects.title: A report on ambidexterity at DSM
projects.description:
It is widely accepted that the successful companies are ambidextrous, means they efficiently 
manage their current business demands while address the changes in the marketplace (Gibson 
& Birkinshaw, 2004). A firm’s ability to jointly pursue both exploitative and explorative 
innovation has been conceived as having positive performance effects, and the mediation 
effect of innovation ambidexterity between structural, contextual, and leadership 
characteristics on a firm’s performance (Chang & Hughes, 2012). Ambidexterity relates to 
attainting balance between incremental innovations (i.e., represents relatively minor 
adaptations of existing products and business concepts) and radical innovations (i.e., 
fundamental changes leading to a switch from existing products or concepts to completely 
new ones).

 In (Raisch & Birkinshaw, 2008), three dimensions in an organization__ organizational 
structure, behavioral contexts, and leadership processes__ are described as promoters of 
ambidexterity. Structural antecedents focus on developing a structural mechanism to cope 
with competing demands in a firm to balance exploitive and explorative innovation. The 
presence of organic or mechanistic enables a firm to alternate between these two 
requirements.

 Also, contextual relates to shaping a set of systems and processes that define a context that 
allows exploration and exploitation to take place and hence individuals can be directed to 
innovate ambidextrously. In addition, leadership antecedent emphasizes on role of top 
managers in engendering ambidextrous behavior, by using exploitation of existing practices 
and exploring within and pressing towards new frontiers. (Chang & Hughes, 2012)

In this paper, we investigate Innovation ambidexterity and Innovation Management within 
DSM.

projects.title: ‘An	investigation	into	the possibility of constructing an artificial island	in the Netherlands.
projects.description:
The objective of the study is to provide a clear answer whether the construction of an artificial 
island in the Waddenzee will be a profitable investment taking into account all stakeholders. 

The feasibility study is divided in two consecutive phases. In the first phase three general 
concepts will be designed in cooperation with the client. After this preliminary study, a winning 
concept will be selected, which will be assessed on financial, economic, technical, infrastructure 
and environmental feasibility. These will be performed in parallel in different teams, which 
consists of both internal and external staff.

projects.title: Marketing Plan for Square
projects.description:
The report focuses on the marketing plan for Square and what marketing strategy the company should follow to become a competitive player in the mobile online payment market.

The report contains a detailed description of the product, focusing on its development and functioning. It has been three years since Square entered as a leader in the Mobile payment market, which now has grown big and has a lot of players. An analysis of the competitors and cost comparisons pointed out that the main competitor is GoPayment but Square has a favorable payment system.

Adaption of Square according to the latest technology and demands of the market is the next step in the analysis. The Square already crossed the ‘Chasm’ and a strategy and selection of the market segments proved that the three main sections to target are the “the average sales volume and higher sales volumes businesses”, “businesses with fluctuations in their volume of sale amount” and “merchants which rely on good customer services”.

To gain access to these market segments, possible market research methods are proposed to be employed by Square Inc. for promoting different versions of Square. For risk assessment and propositions on which field to improve the company a SWOT analysis and a multi-attribute model have been included.

Overall Grade : 7.5/10

profile_positions.description:
Digitally transforming Container Shipping, by establishing standards for a common technology foundation that enables global collaboration. The goal of DCSA is to make shipping services easy to use, flexible, efficient, reliable and environmentally friendly.
As a lead for Track and Trace Standard and Product Owner I am responsible for : 

- Accountable for shaping and delivering digital standards. These standards are key enabler for end-to-end digitalisation of container shipping.

- Managing timelines, deliverables and product team including IT, Marketing. Partnering cross-functionally with different stakeholders within the container shipping industry.  

- Accountable for Project Risk Management and mitigations

- Defining Business case, project scope, goals and objectives, translating them into SMART OKRs

- Communicating with C-Level, leadership teams and key stakeholders to ensure goal alignment

- Organizing and executing weekly stakeholder meetings and workshops with 30+ experts from the carriers

- As a Product owner prioritizing the product backlog and creating user stories to support APIs development

- Represent DCSA as Program Lead to Build, manage and extend relationships with key stakeholders including but not limited to Beneficial Cargo Owner(BCOs), Shippers, Freight Forwarders and 3rd party platforms

- Support Public Affairs in aligning data standarization objectives for Track & Trace with regulatory and governmental bodies like UNCEFACT, IMO, EU commission, DoT and FMC

- Design and validate end-to-end processes for container shipping spanning across a wide domain of documentation, container flows and vessel planning

Keywords: Product Management, Digital Standards, Digital Transformation, API Development, Program Management, Product Owner, Business Process Design, Logistics, Shipping, Standardization

profile_positions.description:

Facilitating workshops based on Lean Start up and Design thinking fundamentals.
In the Q4 2018, I was part of Fluor's Annual Innovation Strategy conference, where a group of 40 individuals selected from Global Fluor offices gathered together to tackle challenges posed by our clients in difference business lines such as Energy and Chemicals, Metals and Mining, Life Sciences and Power industry.

Over a period of months we developed a Minimum Viable Solution, to improve the data handover processes. After a successful shark tank with CXO's this project received a funding of USD 100,000 to move into phase 2.

profile_positions.description:
Maintenance and Repairs

QHSE Compliance
